# if_else() and case_when(): Comparison {#ifelsecasewhen}

## case_when()

case_when() from <https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/dplyr/versions/0.7.8/topics/case_when>

```{r}
x <- 1:50
y <- 51:100

df <- data.frame(x,y)
df

case_when(
  x %% 35 == 0 ~ "fizz buzz",
  x %% 5 == 0 ~ "fizz",
  x %% 7 == 0 ~ "buzz",
  TRUE ~ as.character(x)
)
```


## Compare this with if_else()
```{r}
if_else(x %% 2 == 0, "even", "odd")
```
